io.smudgr.app.controller

Interface Controllable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProjectItem, ReflectableType
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AppControl, AutomatorControl
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BeatAutomator, BlendParameter, BooleanParameter, CurrentSourceControl, DownsampleAutomator, EasingAutomator, NumberParameter, Parameter, RecordGIFControl, SaveFrameControl, SaveProjectControl, SourceLibraryControl, StepAutomator, UnivariateParameter

    public interface Controllable
extends ProjectItem
    Interface for defining a controllable action, behavior, etc for use throughout the app.

      • getTypeName

        java.lang.String getTypeName()
        Unique name to identify this control by.
        Specified by:
        getTypeName in interface ReflectableType
        Returns:
        The name of this controllable.
        See Also:

      • inputValue

        void inputValue(int value)
        Trigger an inputed value on this control. For generic use with devices or programs that may return a discrete value from some source of input.
        Parameters:
        value - Any integer representing the input of some source.

      • inputOn

        void inputOn()
        Trigger an 'on' input event on this control. For generic use with devices or programs that may return boolean state information from some source of input.
        See Also:
        inputOff()

      • inputOff

        void inputOff()
        Trigger an 'off' input event on this control. For generic use with devices or programs that may return boolean state information from some source of input.
        See Also:
        inputOn()

      • increment

        void increment()
        Trigger an increment event on this control. For generic use with devices or programs that may return incremental events from some source of input.
        See Also:
        decrement()

      • decrement

        void decrement()
        Trigger a decrement event on this control. For generic use with devices or programs that may return incremental events from some source of input.
        See Also:
        increment()
